Description: Lid sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; exterior: trace of undetermined motif inside two lines at turn to rim; lotus bud and flower frieze and wide band on top of rim; frieze of diagonals on edge; on underside, black-figure decoration consisting of lion (head missing; added red on mane, underbelly and haunch), to right; incised pendant, rising and full rosettes with red centres as filling ornament; at edge of bowl part of glazed area; two modern drill holes.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group A of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The decoration on the vases from this group is the most elaborate. The rosette has a standard cogwheel shape and the figures are carefully drawn and details are expertly incised.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 145, p. 147, p. 313, no. 1334)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. XII, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2077) (phase 2)
